result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc A Sivrais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine, costs and payment plan fee to be paid at a rate of $25 per month commencing 1-15-16 until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

defendant.name: Sivrais, Marc A
defendant.address: 722 S Kuester Ln, West Bend, WI 53090

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Resolution reached.  Defendant waives right to attorney; Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel and Court accepts waiver.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and imposes a fine of $316 plus $200 DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $25 per month commencing 1-15-16 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Pretrial held.
